blurbs.text: Alaska ranks #2 in business tax climate per the @taxfoundation, and maintaining a taxpayer-friendly environment is on the minds of many legislators as they grapple with revenue volatility issues
Arkansas taxpayers have reason to be optimistic about the prospects for tax reform, but for now, the state's business tax climate ranks a disappointing 45th on the @taxfoundation Index
California ranks #49 in business tax climate, and increasingly, businesses are taking notice despite everything else the state offers. More from the @taxfoundation

Connecticut's business tax climate improved slightly as a corporate surcharge phased down, but the Nutmeg State still has the nation's 3rd worst rank on the @taxfoundation State Business Tax Climate Index.
Delaware improved to 11th in @taxfoundation business tax climate rankings as lawmakers scrapped an estate tax that raised little revenue and drove high earners out of state.
The District of Columbia completed the final stage of its multi-year tax reform, though if it were a state, it would still rank 46th on business tax climate. More from @taxfoundation
Florida has the 4th best business tax climate in the country according to a new @taxfoundation report. It doesn't hurt that the state forgoes an income tax.
Georgia taxpayers will see lower tax rates next year. The state's business tax climate currently ranks 33rd, and can be expected to improve on @taxfoundation rankings once reform kicks in
Hawaii dropped to 38th on business tax climate after legislators reimposed three "temporary" income tax bracketsâ€”with a top rate of 11%! More from the @taxfoundation
Idaho policymakers responded to new revenue from federal tax reform by giving it back to taxpayers, cutting PIT and CIT rates and improving to 21st on the @taxfoundation business tax climate index
Illinois lawmakers have doubled down on high business tax rates in recent years, and it shows, with the state ranking 36th on the @taxfoundation State Business Tax Climate Index
Indiana continues to reform its tax code and cut tax rates, most recently with a CIT cut from 6 to 5.75%. No wonder the state ranks #10 on the @taxfoundation State Business Tax Climate Index
Iowa ranks an unenviable 45th in business tax climate, but with tax reforms set to phase in starting next year, things can only improve. More from @taxfoundation
Kansas slipped to 21st in business tax climate per @taxfoundation as recurring revenue shortfalls forced another round of rate increases.
Kentucky improved 16 spots, from #39 to #23, on the @taxfoundation State Business Tax Climate Index after adopting comprehensive tax reform this year
Louisiana's sales tax rate nudged down, but a convoluted tax code with high rates still has the state at #44 on the @taxfoundation State Business Tax Climate Index
Massachusetts: it's not your father's "Taxachusetts" anymore, ranking 29th on business tax climate according to the @taxfoundation

Missouri legislators approved PIT and CIT rate cuts in the waning days of session, but they don't go into effect until next year. For now, the Show-Me State ranks 14th in business tax climate on @taxfoundation Index
Nebraska is middle of the pack (#24) on its business tax climate according to a new @taxfoundation report
New Hampshire is the Live Free or Die State, and that ethos shows up in its tax code, with the @taxfoundation ranking NH #6 on business tax climate

New Jersey now has double-digit top rates for both its individual (10.75%) and corporate (11.5%) income taxes, more bad news for the state that continues to rank worst on the @taxfoundation State Business Tax Climate Index
New Mexico is #25 in business tax climate after completing a phase-down of its corporate income tax rate to 5.9%. More from the @taxfoundation

New York is #48 on business tax climate, but it does surprisingly well on the corporate tax itself (7th best on the corporate tax component of the @taxfoundation Index) following several years of reforms
North Carolina ranks #12 on business tax climate, vying with UT and IN for the best rank among states levying all the major tax types, according to new @taxfoundation rankings
Ohio's gross receipts tax (the CAT) drags it down on @taxfoundation business tax climate rankings, where the state ranks an unenviable 42nd

Pennsylvania has one of the highest-rate and least competitive corporate income taxes in the country, contrasted with a highly competitive individual income tax. The state ranks 34th on overall business tax climate per the @taxfoundation
Rhode Island ranks 37th on business tax climate, with policymakers working to make the state's UI taxes more competitive. More from @taxfoundation
South Dakota boasts the nation's third best business tax climate according to the latest research from the @taxfoundation
Texas ranks #15 in business tax climate, with an anachronistic gross receipts tax interfering with an otherwise enviable tax code. More from the @taxfoundation
Utah has the 8th best business tax climate in the country, and the best of any state which levies all the major taxes, per new @taxfoundation report

Vermont trimmed its top marginal income tax rate and eliminated a bracket in response to anticipated revenue increases from federal tax reform. The result? An improvement to #41 on business tax climate per @taxfoundation
Washington ranks #20 on business tax climate per the @taxfoundation, but that rank could be in jeopardy as state policymakers contemplate a bevy of new and higher taxes
Wyoming once again boasts the best business tax climate in the nation according to the @taxfoundation State Business Tax Climate Index
